thread.title: Dearborn Chuck E. Cheese customer pulls gun from pants, gets arrested
thread.title_full: Dearborn Chuck E. Cheese customer pulls gun from pants, gets arrested

author: Detroit Free Press
title: Dearborn Chuck E. Cheese customer pulls gun from pants, gets arrested
text:
Dearborn Chuck E. Cheese customer pulls gun from pants, gets arrested A fight inside the restaurant broke out during a birthday party, police said. Post to Facebook Dearborn Chuck E. Cheese customer pulls gun from pants, gets arrested A fight inside the restaurant broke out during a birthday party, police said.   Freep.com: http://on.freep.com/2lAhraG   2   Dearborn Chuck E. Cheese customer pulls gun from pants, gets arrested Perry A. Farrell , Detroit Free Press Published 2:16 p.m. ET Feb. 23, 2017 | Updated 49 minutes ago Chauntez Stephens (Photo: Dearborn Police) 5 CONNECT 2 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
A customer at Chuck E. Cheese in Dearborn is facing felony charges after police said he pulled a gun out of his pants during a fight at a birthday party at the restaurant. 
Chauntez Stephens was arraigned before 19th District Court Judge Gene Hunt on a charge of carrying a concealed weapon. Bond was set at $25,000. A probable cause hearing is scheduled for 9 a.m. on March 3. 
Related: After ‘night of sheer terror,’ mom turned to McDonald’s worker for help 
The incident happened Feb. 19, when police were called to the restaurant on Michigan Avenue near Telegraph. Witnesses said a fight broke out between Stephens and another man when Stephens allegedly pulled out a handgun from his pants. 
Police said Stephens ran outside and was confronted by private armed security, who ordered him to drop the weapon. He complied, then fled the scene on foot. 
Police arrested Stephens the next day. 5 CONNECT 2 COMMENT EMAIL MORE
